results.title: Choice for Year Nine
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria and records how the staff of a regional technical school respond to the attitude problems of Year 9 students.

results.title: Red Tape
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program and shows a school community breaking down barriers to encourage community involvement in school decision making. The school draws its pupils from a housing commission estate and the principal’s aim is to create a school that responds to the community rather than the conventional process of making the commnity respond to the bureaucratic needs of the school.

results.title: Why Not the Kids?
results.creator_credit: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria and shows how children can participate in school organisation. Children at a Victorian Primary School formed a committee and applied for and were granted a Supplementary Grant. The children suggested changes in school facilities, organisation and even curricula. In doing so, some of changes that occured challenged teachers’ perceptions of students and caused them to reappraise their role in the school community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Closing the Gap
results.creator_credit: Glenn Mack, Les Mack and Chelsea Studios for the Education Department of Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria. Raises issues of concern for those attempting to bridge the gap between schools and the local community. Depicts the first tentative steps of a small inner-city secondary school.
Filmed at the historic, heritage registered building on City Road, Southbank, formerly the J.H. Boyd Girls’ High School, now (2017) known as the ‘Boyd Community Hub’.

results.title: Blue like an orange
results.brief_description: Puppets of the Orient and the Occident are presented in this UNESCO contribution to understanding between East and West. Scenes of puppet plays in India, Japan, Singapore, Malaysia, Laos, Poland, Czechoslovakia and the United States today. The presentations illustrate the great variety of the traditions which have survived for thousands of years. Also includes archival footage of Jim Henson and “the muppets” including a very early Kermit.

results.title: The Dam builders
results.creator_credit: Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works and Cine Service
results.brief_description: Gives a brief history of the Melbourne water supply system and the efforts of the MMBW to create enjoyable environments such as landscaping and recreation facilities in several catchment areas. Highlights the construction of the Cardinia Reservoir, near Emerald, now the largest storage area for Melbourne.

results.title: The City of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Roger Climpson narrates this concise and interesting film on Melbourne. A brief history is outlined at the beginning noting some of the key figures who moved Melbourne from a settlement to a city, including John Batman and John Fawker. An incredible amount of material is fitted into the film’s short duration, including the outer central business locations like Albert Park, Flemington, St Kilda and Northland Shopping Centre, Preston. The newer multi-story buildings in the city are attractively shot. Opening shot of the infamous (now demolished) Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria building in its early stages of construction. Also includes footage of the Robin Boyd Southgate fountain sculpture in Snowden Gardens.
